title: "quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.generation.create-schemas" doesn't work anymore when generation is set to "update"
body:
### Describe the bug

Database: postgresql

According to the documentation at [https://quarkus.io/guides/hibernate-orm](https://quarkus.io/guides/hibernate-orm), if the property "quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.generation.create-schemas" is set to true, it is supposed to create automatically the schema at launch.

The property "quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.default-schema" is set with "quarkus" for example.

The schema is not created when the property "quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.generation" is set to update. (The schema is created if the property is set to create).

This property perfectly works with quarkus 2.5.0.Final

### Expected behavior

When the property "quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.generation.create-schemas" is set to true, it is supposed to create automatically the schema "quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.default-schema" at launch even if the property "quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.generation" is set to update

### Actual behavior

The schema in "quarkus.hibernate-orm.database.default-schema" is not created.

### How to Reproduce?

[hibernate-orm-quickstart.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/10313572/hibernate-orm-quickstart.zip)
